flawed_nl_solution:
The fair made $2520 from tickets, so they had 2520 / 5 = <<2520/5=504.0>>504.0 people attend the fair.
Two-thirds of those people will buy food, so 504.0 * 2 / 3 = <<504.0*2/3=336.0>>336.0 people will buy food.
The fair will make 336.0 * 8 = $<<336.0*8=2688.0>>2688.0 from food.
A quarter of the people will go on a ride, so 504.0 / 4 = <<504.0/4=126.0>>126.0 people will go on a ride.
The fair will make 126.0 * 4 = $<<126.0*4=504.0>>504.0 from rides.
An eighth of the people will buy a souvenir, so 504.0 / 8 = <<504.0/8=36.0>>36.0 people will buy souvenirs.
The fair will make 36.0 * 15 = $<<36.0*15=540.0>>540.0 from souvenirs.
In all, the fair will make 2520 + 2688.0 + 504.0 + 540.0 = $<<2520+2688.0+504.0+540.0=6252.0>>6252.0.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 63.0, not 36.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
